Reviews.Title: “Hotel32 When your are in the mood to treat yourself”
Reviews.Author: TNJOverson
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Stay. Very clean room with great beds and comfortable pillows. The concierge on the floor was awesome. Helped us several times during our stay. Breakfast was more than expected and great service. Great area to hang out, enjoy a drink, etc. I did not get a chance to see what was offered in the afternoon but after a long night it was nice to have bottle water, fruit, soda, etc at any hour.

Reviews.Title: “Understated sophistication and genuine service in an otherwise artificial city.”
Reviews.Author: Seattleboarder
Reviews.Content: Hotel32 at the Monte Carlo isn't just a segregated “economy-plus” floor carelessly delineating a different fare class through décor or improved view. While it’s true the accommodations are more high end, the details are numerous and well thought out combining everything to make the most memorable part of Hotel32 the overall experience. From the warm greeting and limo ride from the airport to the use of my name numerous by the suite staff, simple touches made my 5 day stay in a strange city feel exclusive, yet familiar. My loft (38) at the end of the hall was one of the larger ones that overlooked the Vegas skyline with neon lights of Aria and the Crystals in the forefront. The room was well laid out and the modern yet understated furnishings were accessible for someone used to a cozy Seattle home. There were 3 flatscreen TVs, and a portable handheld touch screen device in the living room and bed room to control entertainment, lights, and drapes. While convenient enough to have the all this in one device, I did find using it to change channels on the TV less user friendly than a regular remote. French sliding doors open from the bedroom into the well-lit bathroom with a two sinks, a jet bathtub, and Kiehls toiletries. My favorite part of the room was the Opera shower, with an electronic wall mount controlling overhead colored lights and water flowing from the ceiling, showerhead, and sides. I fear I may never enjoy another regular shower again. I woke up on the Serta Presidential Pillow top mattress, feeling refreshed and like I had slept soundly through the night (which is rare for me in hotels). The staff (Joel and Ashley in particular) was friendly, helpful and accommodating without it feeling contrived and forced. They all seemed like they genuinely enjoyed their job. There is a small VIP lounge on the floor, with complimentary snacks at breakfast and before dinner. I especially liked the chorizo egg quiche in the morning. The red Hote32 key card also allows you a free locker in the Spa area, which is the access point to a well outfitted gym. While there were numerous machines, it did get crowded in the morning particularly for the cardio machines. After your workout, a cold pool, hot tub, steam and sauna room are accessible in the Spa. Unfortunately, the pool wasn’t open, so I can’t speak to it yet. Overall, I think Hotel32 offers you an exclusive high-class experience in a high to midrange casino/hotel in the heart of the strip. Its understated sophistication is accessible and doesn’t feel at all manufactured in a city that makes its livelihood on being artificial.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 32 is fantastic”
Reviews.Author: exfedup
Reviews.Content: Staying at Hotel 32 would not be the same without suite assistants Joel, Amber, Ashley, Parie & Sonya. Also Oscar and Janet lounge personal. Everyone went over and above to make us feel like royalty. Having breakfast each day in a nice but quite area was just what my wife was looking for. The evening options were just as nice We had a suite for our stay. The view of our room overlooked the mountains. The suite was huge. The bathroom was just as large and the shower was just fabulous. What a great way to start and end each day in a shower with multiple shower heads. My wife took advantage of the spa which she said was just magnificent. We gambled enough during our five day stay that the bit bosses knew us by name early on during our stay. We did not encounter even one poor dealer; they all were truly there to keep us happy even if we lost a hand or two. We checked out some other MGM Property casinos and glad we were at the Monte Carlo - it seemed more intimate than the others. The restaurants had great food and we were served quickly. Needless to say when our travels take us back to Las Vegas - we will choose Hotel 32.

Reviews.Title: “Room with nice view”
Reviews.Author: Faulekatze
Reviews.Content: The suite that we originally booked was not available so luckily we got upgraded to one of the loft in Hotel 32. To get up to the 32nd floor you'd need to use the room key card in the elevator, and there was a separate desk service just for that floor from 6 am to 11 pm I think. Also there was a public lounge area where they serve breakfast, drinks, fruits, coffee, and hors d'oeuvres. Now to the room. I loved the room the moment I stepped in. It's got a nice view and everything was designed to provide convenience and comfort. I really liked the remote control system for the TV, curtain and lighting, that was really cool. What I was especially impressed is the bathroom. The jet tub was huge and the shower was awesome! There were several shower heads and you could control the temperature, lighting, music, ambiance and more! This room was one of the best thing for us on this Vegas trip :)

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL32 does not live up to its own idea of luxury”
Reviews.Author: Washingtonianwoman
Reviews.Content: A recent 4 day stay on HOTEL32 was slightly disappointing. This is located on the 32nd floor of the Monte Carlo so most of the facilities that you will use are part of the Monte Carlo. My room was a "suite" which turned out to be pretty standard room. There is a nice lounge for the exclusive use of HOTEL32 guests. The service by the staff on HOTEL32 is excellent so this does somewaht make up for the less than spectacular "suites". I used the fitness room on floor 2 of the hotel everyday and it was almost full each time. I recommend working out later in the day versus the morning if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing really special”
Reviews.Author: PandM0
Reviews.Content: Did not have a suite, just a regular room. Nice, but seemed dated. Bath really small and too bright. Room was nice, but nothing really special. The elevator to access the top floor the rooms are on was dirty, and is used by a lot of other hotel guests in the Monte Carlo. Not a good introduction to this "special" hotel on the top floor. Nice to have the club lounge which had some good breakfast things out--didn't visit for dinner. Far better other hotels nearby, namely the Mandarin, Vdara and Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel32 Round 2...Still Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: RubySohoPDX
Reviews.Content: Back in August I posted a general review of Hotel32 (http://tinyurl.com/h32review) and my general sentiments of Hotel32 being a magical place holds true, but I figure I should elaborate on a couple more things that came up on my most recent trip in December such as how great the customer service is and the fact that the studios are definitely awesome. (My husband and I had a loft 3 nights and a studio connected to the loft for 2 nights of the trip for my uncle) First, my husband and I had an early morning flight and landed around 8:30. When our flight landed, our driver was right down the escalators waiting for us. I only mention this because some have noted that there has been an issue with transportation but I have not experienced that. Once we got to Monte Carlo, it was about 9ish and I was fully expecting to be told that a room wasn’t ready and to return in a couple of hours. Early check in around noon is one thing, but to expect a room 6 hours before check-in is supposed to start is a different story. Having said that, to my surprise, they actually had a loft available, so I checked in at VIP and off I went up to the 32nd floor. Once we got up to Hotel32 we were greeted by one of the best suite assistants ever, Joel. He actually remembered me and my husband from our previous trip in August. That is am impressive memory! Our room was exactly how we remembered it, same quality and cleanliness upon the first scan so we just left our stuff in the room and went off to start the vacation. (Seriously, the rooms look exactly like what is pictured online, overall they’re fantastic!) But a couple notes on the bathroom and technology situation with the loft suites- First-while the tub is absolutely splendid, it’s mildly dangerous. It’s extremely easy to slip while getting in and out. My husband slipped and hit his leg and still has a bruise a week later. I almost slipped one time but caught myself, it’s just something to be aware of. Also, the morning we were checking out I went to take a shower and the screen was being super weird and changing temps constantly (ie going from 94 to 103 to 99 to 111 etc) My husband and I watched it for a couple minutes and it never settled on a temp. I tried changing the brightness of the lights to see if maybe it was just the control being weird, and the control wasn’t changing the brightness either (it could do a color change but not affect the brightness.) Since we had to check out that morning I decided to just forget about it and get ready. I let Sonia, one of the suite assistants, know about the shower issue so it could be checked out before the next guests checked into the room, but not 10 minutes later engineering was knocking at the door to get it taken care of. In maybe 10 more minutes, she said it was fixed. All before we were ready to head out for the day. In regards to the technology in the rooms, the controls that are supposed to be wireless couldn’t be removed from their stand for any longer than about 5 or 10 minutes, the batteries just were not holding charges. When they were docked they worked flawlessly, but just couldn’t part with the charger. On the second day of our stay we also checked into a connecting studio because my uncle was joining us. This was the first time I had seen a studio and it was really nice! I personally think it was very roomy and I would not be hesitant to book a stay in a studio if for some reason I couldn’t stay in a loft. We had the studio for 2 nights and my uncle had no complaints. There was an issue with the hold on my credit card for the studio (an extra night was on there and a discount I was receiving on the room had not been applied.) I spoke with Roy about it and everything got cleared up while I snacked on some tuna tartare hors d'oeuvres in the lounge. The issue was resolved in less than 5 minutes. Another minor issue was on the last night of our stay we could not get a hold of anyone to have some water brought to the room (we tried room service, guest service, and housekeeping and all the lines were busy) so my husband went down to the gift shop to buy some water but he couldn’t charge it to the room even though I had filled out the paper allowing both him and my uncle to bill to both the loft and studio. It was nothing big, just a minor inconvenience which I mentioned to Sonia when I spoke with her about the shower issue. Sonia spoke with Nina the manager and they more than made up for both the shower and minor water inconvenience. Even though the trip had a couple very small bumps, the customer service throughout the stay was excellent and I still consider Hotel32 my home hotel in Vegas. What truly sets it apart is the customer service. Yes, for the same price as a studio you could stay at the elite luxury places on the strip but you’re not going to get a limo to/from the airport, snacks in the morning and evening and the fantastic guest service that each suite assistant provides And in regards to the suite assistants, I just want to give a quick shout out to Joel, he was at the desk every morning to greet us and helped us set up anything we needed for that day. Staying at Hotel 32 I felt like my business was appreciated and I can’t wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “More bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: LondonClaireW
Reviews.Content: I really can't speak highly enough of Hotel32. We'd been staying at the Bellagio on previous visits, but ended up spending most of our slot playing time in the Monte Carlo, so decided we'd take a look at their rooms............and discovered Hotel32. Our flight was delayed and we were a little worried about the limo pick up. We needn't have been, He was there waiting to whisk us away to the hotel. We were greeted at the front door by Ed who took us straight up to Hotel32 and got us checked in. Our room was a Loft suite, and was lovely....far lovelier than an equivalently priced suite at Bellagio. A total of 4 televisions with a very snazzy remote control! The shower and bath were a revelation too, with the mood lighting and all the different settings. We found the provision of soft drinks and coffee in the lounge was a god send. We usually head off upon arriveal to buy soft drinks and milk, having brought a travel kettle with us, but no need as it was all there in the lounge. The suite assistants were very helpful. We'd phoned ahead to ask for show tickets, which had all been sorted out for us when we arrived. And on the one occasion that turn down hadn't happened, Roy sorted out a real chocolate treat for us to make up for the missing little chocolates usually left on the bed. When we were leaving, our limo was a few minutes late, and the staff couldn't have been more helpful, telephoning the limo company and staying with us until it arrived (10 minutes late). So, our experience was (as with most people reporting back on here) wonderful and we will definitely be going to Hotel32 on our next trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location on the strip.close to monorail.”
Reviews.Author: dinothedog
Reviews.Content: Good value..buffet in hotel good..full up with à full english!.breakfast..See you right until dinner..good pool..lively pub..huge choice of beers..minus 5 ice bar fun..but expensive...cantinas bar Outside hotel lively

Reviews.Title: “"Let's get you home"”
Reviews.Author: MarkDC-Travel
Reviews.Content: I get to Vegas a few times a year and, since Sept 2009, have stayed at 16 different hotels from Wynn on the North end of the strip to Mandalay Bay on the south end in 25 different room & suite types. Unlike the high rollers who stay in Vegas comped by the casinos, I’ve only taken two comps during my stays. Rather than worry about how much I’ll gamble, I research to find the best bargains possible and book as far as 7 months in advance. I stayed at Hotel32 in a Loft Suite 32-033 September 28 & 29, 2011 on a discounted rate found on twitter open to all called "TeamPREZ Getaway" which gave me 20% off the Loft Suite, 20% off at Brand, the Steakhouse, 20% Off Spa Service and 20% Off Minus5 (a specialty bar) Package. Having enjoyed my previous stays at the Monte Carlo in the past, I had done extensive research on Hotel32, the boutique hotel on the top floor. I’ve stayed in Monte Carlo’s Monaco, Spa and Diamond suites and was really looking forward to seeing what they did with Hotel32. Was I ever impressed. Two days before my arrival, I sent an email with my flight info and asked for an appointment to be set up at the salon for a haircut. I received a response from my “suite assistant”, Joel saying that everything was set. Sure enough, upon arrival at the airport, about 10:45AM, there was a limo driver with a Hotel32 sign. I only take carry-on with my on my Vegas trips and use the hotel laundry so there was no waiting for luggage. The driver took my carry-on and said “let’s get you home”. This attitude of making me feel at home was everywhere. Since was alone, I only expected a Town Car. Nope, it was a stretch limo. Upon arrival at the Monte Carlo, I checked in at the VIP lounge and they actually had the suite ready. I immediately went up to check out the new digs for the next two nights. As you can see from the pictures, it is modern and oh so cool. Rather than go on and on about the room, I’ll let the pictures do the talking and I’ll just write about what I liked or didn’t like… First, the suite is very high tech. Buttons for this and that, but nothing too complicated. Since I go to Vegas often, I’m not in a rush and I do like to spend time in my room/suite as well as going out. This suite has four TVs (living area, dining area, bedroom and bathroom) and was the first suite that I was in that had a Blu-ray player. Since I didn’t bring any with me, I didn’t check it out. However, not only did the suite have the regular Monte Carlo cable, it also has the Direct TV satellite system. I don’t know how many channels it is, but whatever D-TV has can be found here. This is a great amenity whether you are watching one of the many different sports channels, or even for family viewing. Next up is the coffee maker. I love my morning coffee and hate seeing anyone before I get my caffeine, and that includes room service. Well, this suite has a Jura coffee/espresso maker. The suite is stocked with fresh coffee beans and this machine grinds the beans just before brewing the coffee. I haven’t seen this on the strip before. There is milk in the fridge, but they will also put half & half in it if you ask. While the bathroom has a Hydrotherapy soaking tub, I loved the shower, with its 8 different sprays of water, 4 from the ceiling, the regular shower head, and three more body sprays from the wall. All have the same force and quantity of spray. Ya, it has color and music settings, but just give me the “basic” water sprays. Now I know what a car in an automatic car wash feels like. Clean everywhere! The bed was very comfortable what more do you need in a bedroom. I think there was a Blu-ray player there too, and yes this had Direct TV as well. One nice thing about the room was that the windows were clean and they could also be opened a few inches. I like fresh air and there aren’t a lot of hotels with windows that actually open. Monte Carlo, Mirage on the lower floors and Tropicana all have the ability to open windows. Most of the hotels I’ve stayed in have floor to ceiling glass windows so they will not open. Joel was my “Suite Assistant”. He did a great job as showing me around, picking up my laundry, making the appointment for my haircut (Rindy in the MC salon has cut my hair three times now and she always does a great job! Thanks Rindy you are the greatest), answering any questions, and making arrangements for my departure. He’s been in the business for years and it shows. Thank you, Joel. There is also a special “Lounge 32” on the floor which has minor morning (7 to 10 or 11) and evening (4 to 8?) finger foods as well as coffee, water and soft drinks all day long. My first night they had lobster puffs and the second night was some sort of Chinese bun with one a bit of sushi. In the morning, there was quiche and some salmon as well. These are finger foods and not meant to substitute as a meal although some think it does. Oscar does a terrific job at maintaining the lounge during the evening and he can get you whatever you might like. If you prefer spirits, they have that, but you will have to pay extra for it. One of the benefits of the “Team Prez” deal was 20% off at Brand, Monte Carlo’s steakhouse. I knew I wanted the tomahawk ribeye (tomahawk referring to the bone-in which is huge). It was good, a little steakhouse crispy on the outside in places, but rare, as ordered in the center. B+ for that, but the waiter, Brian, suggested the Brand salad and I went GaGa over it. It was so good. Green beans, tomato, shrimp and bacon pieces with some sort of vinaigrette that was not overwhelming. I’m not a salad guy but bacon & shrimp could be staples in my home any day. Thanks Brian, that was my favorite part of the meal. When it was time to check out, I noticed $600+ in mini-bar charges from the previous guest were on my bill, but that was quickly rectified. Although the limo service is only to and from the airport, Joel did manage to get it for my next stop, the Mirage. Thanks again Joel. With all the good things I‘ve had to say, I want to make it clear that I stayed in the Loft Suite. The regular suite and the Studio do not have the same shower, but only a regular shower. And, due to the limited space, they do not have bathtubs either. This is clearly visible to all on their website as is the fact that the limo they provide is supposed to be to and from the airport. Hotel32 made good on every promise made to me, and I really do not have anything negative to say. That said, I have no hesitation giving my recommendation for a stay at Hotel32 in a loft suite. As with any stay in any hotel, call if you have questions to avoid any confusion. Do your homework and you will not be disappointed. Hotel32 is one of the best kept secrets in Las Vegas. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel32 at Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: exfedup
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel 32 in June for 5 nights. We had 2 suites to celebrate our nephews 21st birthday. We had a wonderful time. We gambled alot.. used the spa, pool and many of the resorts restuarants. Hard to believe that anyone could have a bad time here. The lounge staff went over and above to assist us during our stay.. Thanks Oscar. The concierge staff.. Joel, Amber and the others were the best. We wanted for nothing during our stay. It was very hard to leave. Our suite was huge and the shower was the best .

Reviews.Title: “Spend your money elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingPoof
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that we stayed at Hotel32 at a discounted rate so we did not pay full price, thankfully! My husband I stayed in a studio room for 2 nights and I am happy it was not longer! Please do not believe what you see on their website. Here are the Pro and Cons; I believe it's the only fair way to write this review. Pros; The complementary limo service to and from the airport is great! It was nice not to have to worry about how to get to the hotel or back to the airport. The check-in process is fantastic. They know you have arrived before you even reach the floor. The rooms are are nicely decorated in a contemporary design. The lounge32 is also very nice. It's has free coffee, tea, water and soda from open to close. The staff are very helpful and friendly, probably the best part of the hotel! Our room was very clean! Cons; The limo is only to and from the airport. If you would like to take the limo anywhere on the strip it is $80. The elevator, that according to the website is just for Hotel32, is not just for Hotel32. It's for floors 27-32. You need to sign out the mobile concierge, it is not given to you when you check-in, nor does the staff mention or ask you if you would like one. Lounge32 is only open from 7 am to 11 pm. Nowhere on the website does it mention this. Breakfast is mainly finger food, pastries, and some kind of fruit. The only "snacks" that we saw for the 2 days we were there were a bowel of apples. Appetizers are served starting at 4 and there is not much to choose from. Our room was small! Our refrigerator was never stocked with anything, not even water! The biggest con is the false impression of luxury that the website gives you as we did not experience anything that was advertised! Overall, I would recommend you spend your money elsewhere. Vegas has numerous luxury hotels to choose from, unfortunately Hotel32 is not one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Major Dissapointment In a Suite”
Reviews.Author: kman008
Reviews.Content: Wow, I am astonished by the good reviews on here but maybe the reviews reflect the Lofts/Penthouse rooms instead of the basic and regular suites. I was stayed on a comped offer in a Suite, a 700+sq ft room. I was hesitant to stay here because I normally stay at places such as Aria/Caesars/Wynn/Venetian/Cosmo, etc. The website advertised free Voss water and Kiel's amenities but when I stayed there in the beginning of August, it looks like those were no longer being offered. Bath amenities given are what you would receive at the regular Monte Carlo hotel. Water was free but was just your small little bottles with a HOTEL32 label on it to replace the MC label that you would get on the casino floor. You also get unlimited amount of free small bottles of Pepsi or Sierra Mist. As mentioned before, I stayed in a SUITE. Other reviewer on here has pictures of either a Loft of Penthouse which looks really good. I will give a review on the suite. This suite was IMO, worse than others that in the price range if I had actually paid for it. The bed was pretty comfortable and the bathroom had dual sinks. There was only one TV in the room but get this, there was NO bath tub in this suite. IMO, this is unheard of. No bath tub in what is suppose to be a higher end Vegas hotel? Wow. There was also no ironing board or iron to be found in the room. I am pretty sure I could have asked for one but shouldn't it come standard in the room like all the other rooms in Vegas? The Hotel32 lobby and lounge was cool but the lounge didn't offer too much. Don't be expecting to fill up etc but if you go there the right time, you can snack. If I had to do it again, I wouldn't do it again. I stayed here for free but I sure would have been pissed off if I had to pay full rate since for the same rate, I could have stayed at any of the other hotels I mentioned earlier.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome trip, already planning round two!”
Reviews.Author: RubySohoPDX
Reviews.Content: My husband told me he wanted to stay at Hotel 32 at Monte Carlo and I was extremely hesitant to say the least. We were looking at properties like Bellagio and Wynn, and it's no secret that MCs property just doesn't compare but I decided to just go with it because if the Hotel 32 experience was a flop, there would always be another Vegas trip. Now that the trip is over, I am SO GLAD we went with Hotel 32! When we arrived, the driver provided by the hotel was waiting for us and even knew which baggage carousel our bags were on and gathered them for us. There were chilled bottles of Voss waiting for us when we got in the limo and the ride to the hotel was very pleasant. Once we arrive at the property, a bellhop got our luggage and escorted us up the the 32nd floor (Skipping the CRAZY check in lines at the front desk was great!). One of the suite assistants, Joel (who was just fantastic and extremely helpful throughout our whole stay) checked us in and showed us our room, explaining how everything worked (We were in a Loft suite, which has a ton of tech in it such as the various controls for the shower's water and light settings). The room was absolutely fantastic and matched exactly what the website showed online (which is hard to say for many hotels). There was a small issue with the bluetooth connection which the AV guys couldn't quite figure out, but they provided us with a cable which worked just fine to connect our mp3 players to the system, so no real issue there. Part of staying at Hotel 32 means you have access to the lounge which has great snacks in the morning and evening. For example, there were mini-eggs benedict and yogurt parfaits in the morning and veal meatballs and lobster puffs in the afternoon. My husband and I also did a pool day at MC (but the suite assistants can hook guests up with reservations at any MLife property pool). We rented a daybed, which was excellent. Dawn and Michelle were absolutely fantastic servers, keeping us well supplied in daiquiris and snacks throughout the day. We seriously never had an empty glass all day! Of course, the rest of the Monte Carlo property isn't as mind blowing as Hotel32, but the tram to Aria/City Center/Bellagio is a great option to play at higher end properties So, key final thoughts- Hotel 32's accommodations (loft suites) are FANTASTIC Joel was an excellent suite assistant willing to go above and beyond for guests If you're gonna spend time at the pool, go for a daybed and ask for Dawn or Michelle (Although I'm sure they aren't the only great servers!). I've grown up going to Las Vegas, have logged well over 30 trips, and have stayed at almost every property on the strip (and a few off strip) and Hotel 32 is officially my favorite and I think my husband and I will be making it our home-base for any foreseeable trips to come; we're already planning on booking for December (I say this after one trip to MC 5 yrs ago or so, having vowed to never step foot on the property again)! And as a side note, overall I think that MC is making strides in the right direction. We went to happy hour at The Pub and the food and service there was fantastic too, and Brand's after hours was...epic, to say the least. All in all, it was a great trip, and I couldn't have asked for anything better!

Reviews.Title: “Best Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: HotelGirl811
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about Nina, Ruth, Amber, Pria, Joel and the rest of the staff at Hotel 32. From start to finish they were courteous, polite, and amazing. Ruth even called on her day off to ensure everything was going well since our last stay with them had been a little disappointing. We were treating my mom to a girls weekend away and she couldn't have been more impressed. The Loft Suites are spacious and beautiful and we will definitely be staying again. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Monte carlo”
Reviews.Author: Classof2001
Reviews.Content: Frankie pagay The engineer was very help out to get great rooms for our class reiuon. He was very helpful and very soulful to show us what slot machine we should play. Frankie pagay is a great person to talk with and etc.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: 3longhorns
Reviews.Content: Hotel 32 made our trip. Moved us up after stripview room was really bad. Having a blast now and return to quiet modern clean room. Can check in here and checkout. Tend to your needs. Lounge offers light snacks that are perfect. Elevators need a repaint job but this room so much nicer!! Only floor to stay on here

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 32...the premium Monte Carlo Hotel Experience!”
Reviews.Author: gastrotraveling
Reviews.Content: Your getaway begins with a limo whisking you from the airport to the Monte Carlo‘s grand entrance where your key card gains you access to the express elevator all the way to the top floor #32. You have arrived at Hotel 32. Whether checking into a studio or ultra-spacious penthouse, luxury abounds. Comfy over sized custom furnishings along with onyx & granite on counter surfaces and bathrooms give the room a customized bright and spacious feel…a place to hang out and feel like you’re not missing a thing outside. You have just joined the ranks of VIP. Art work gracing the walls are authentic paintings by local artists. A fresh fruit assortment of raspberries, blackberries, kumquats greeted me upon entering my room. Thoughtful late night reveler perks like Kettle chips, Fiji water and a can of Red Bull left in my room at turn down helped me successfully transition into the next day. Pairing stunning views of the adjacent Aria and Las Vegas skyline with a delectable selection of specialty cocktails, assorted canapes, or a spot of tea, Lounge 32, straight off the floor’s lobby, is the place to gather any time of the day before venturing out.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at Hotel32”
Reviews.Author: AussieTraveller3204
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Vegas and we had been told to stay in the centre of the strip. Found Hotel32 Monte Carlo on Tripadvisor and thought that it would meet our needs. Great to be collected by limo from the airport - driver waiting by luggage claim for us, perfect. Advantage of Hotel32 is private check in away from the massive lines that fill the main foyer area. Our room was spacious with good views, great bathroom accessories and during our 4 night stay, well serviced each day. The Happy Hour was a way to meet other guests with beautifully presented finger food - not a huge choice, but just perfect for a snack before dinner. Helpful waiters and waitresses, with tips of what to see and where to go. Breakfast was served in the same area - like other reviews there was only one hot dish to select from, but plenty of fresh fruit and other cold selections. Enough to get you started for the day. Also open all day for tea, coffee, soft drinks and bottle water. We were in Vegas to see the sights and experience the diversity of all the hotels in the area. We spent little time at the Monte Carlo itself, returning for a nightcap in the evenings. We did eat at a buffet there - average and at the Chinese Noodle House, where the meal was quite acceptable. The service desk staff on the floor was most helpful, contacting tour agencies that we had already booked from Australia for us. Always pleasant and welcoming when we returned after a long day of sight seeing. We did have a problem one night with excessive noise from the room next door, which was addressed by the hotel staff fairly quickly. We also had a problem with an early morning call that did not come on the day we needed to get to the airport and the limo service did not appear either. On contacting the hotel at a later date they were most apologetic and offered us free accommodation should we return. We would recommend this hotel as a good place to stay in the centre of the strip, with easy access to other hotels via the free tram service.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like celebrities!”
Reviews.Author: grassrootsink
Reviews.Content: The hotel 32 at the Monte Carlo is a true vacation getaway. The staff is just amazing in every way possible. We were treated like we were celebrities the entire stay. The minute we arrived at the airport we were greeted with an attendant to take our luggage and brisk us away in a limousine. The best part of the entire experience was that we really did not have to lift a finger for anything the entire trip. When we got to the monte carlo hotel we were brought to the vip area for drinks and to get our room keys. We were brought up to our room and well lets just say it was amazing. I got a loft that was nothing short of just incredible. From the shower that changes colors to the room that was just lavish with an espresso machine and well had 4 tv's One of the best parts of the trip was lounge 32 where you can get cappuccinos and small food plates to get you threw the day. I can go on and on, about the room, the service, and the hotel 32 in general, but what will keep me coming back is the genuine service I got from meeting the hotel manager, to one of the best people I have dealt with when it came to hotel service joel. all in all, I will definitely be returning as much as possible to the 5 star treatment at the hotel 32.

Reviews.Title: “Not-So-Exclusive - Beautiful, but Elevators Were a Mess”
Reviews.Author: lizzard9
Reviews.Content: The Hotel32 was beautiful, and we really enjoyed using the VIP lounge area for gatherings. However, I have a few gripes that many should be aware of: - ELEVATORS: the much-vaunted special elevators don't really exist!! They painted 2 of the 6 elevators in that area red, but you can't call them, even with your room card. They just show up randomly, and ANYONE can get on them and go to ANY floor. If you're on the 32nd floor, trying to get down to the casino level, you can imagine what a pain it is when it gets stopped at every other floor to let on another batch of slow slack-jawed tourists. NOT FUN, NOT AS PROMISED - The Lounge is just an empty space: It's pretty much unattended during the day and breakfasts were sparse and unimaginative. You'd see the exact same hard hotel pastries every day, and have only one hot option (eggs benedict 2 days in a row??). Want juice? You'd have to chase down the elusive attendant for that. At least twice I tried to get coffee or hot water, only to find out the dispenser was empty. - Monte Carlo Infrastructure: This may be a refined and elegant floor, but it' still on top of a mediocre quality casino hotel. Dining options were limited to a food-court and some bad, no-name restaurants. Air quality was poor, as well. We had to stuff kleenex in the holes in the door jambs to keep smoke from other rooms and/or the casino from pouring in - Loud, Loud Pool Music: the pool scene blared pumping club music that was inescapable even at 32 floors above. This wouldn't be so bad, except they started at 9:00 AM. Really?? - Small Details Forgotten: Maid service was spotty, sometimes forgetting little details like emptying the garbage. Also, one lamp and the electrical outlet at our desk area didn't work. You'd think with only one floor to keep track of, they'd do a better job at maintenance. While it's no Four Seasons, I'd put it at the level of a Wynn Resort room-wise but the main common areas are more like a Marriott. The extra attention and complimentary limo service make it a nice option. However, if you are intent on surrounding yourself in luxury throughout the property, I suggest heading elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: bluewater
Reviews.Content: We had family staying at MC and wanted to stay nearby, but not really at MC - then I found out about Hotel32 and booked. And I'm very glad we did. First off, the ride from the airport was key! Just us, no others - quick out of there and the limo is fun. We were greeted by name at the front door of the hotel and were very quickly on our way to the 32nd floor. Check-in was a breeze - sign and go. The room had a small tray of berries, perfect little snack after the long day we had. We were in one of the small rooms (lofts?) and it was fine for us (although after reading the previous review I would have at least liked to have peeked in one of the larger rooms:) we did plan on spending a lot of down time as we hadn't had a day off since October! It was perfect for us. While there we needed a large document printed and faxed - we were willing to go to and do it ourselves but Hotel32 was more then nice about doing it for us (OMG, I forgot his name....Joel? J name and worked the morning shift - soooo sorry!! I'll call him Joel - ) Joel was so nice and didn't hesitate to do it for us. "Thank you again!!! So sorry if I got your name wrong!" And listening to him speak to other guests - he's a gem to the hotel. We did have one problem, and I in no way shape or form blame the hotel. Bad neighbors. I mean, obnoxious! I travel a lot, I've had noisy neighbors, but these guys were beyond that. Even punching holes in the hallway around 3am. They were in the room behind our bed and sounded like they were throwing each other against the wall making my head pop up (group of guys) and hollering to no end. I can't even explain here how bad it was. Sona was very nice about moving us. (And thank you so much for the wine!! I wanted to thank you in person but missed you) We did hate to complain, but, it was that bad - over 24hrs of yelling and thumps against the wall. I ordered room service once - very prompt and polite. Room was very clean and I spent a lot of time on the nice chaise lounge by the window. Definitely a good value. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend Hotel32. From the website I did get the impression that the elevator was only to our floor - it isn't. Which was fine, but was expecting that from the website. Besides our one group of neighbors it was VERY quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, service and VIP treatment mid-range”
Reviews.Author: yyclhryyc
Reviews.Content: I have stayed @ Hotel32 twice now, once with spouse and the other time with a friend. I have stayed in the 1 bedroom suite and the studio. Obviously the suite is much much better, with amazing ameneties and a great bathroom/jacuzzi/shower. The studio was rather small and just did not have the same pizazz as the suite. I believe Hotel32 is really trying to capture the upscale market. Service was just "okay". Having stayed at Wynn, Bellagio and several other strip hotels, I would say that the service is just not matched. They try hard, but there is something genuine lacking. The gaming of the Monte Carlo is really sub par. And as much as Hotel32 is "upscale" one is hit with a pretty hard reality when you take the elevator down to the casino floor and realize that you are really staying at the Monte Carlo, which includes the whiff of the fast food joints. But, I am staying there again soon, so its really not that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service-Great lounge- even better service”
Reviews.Author: vegastraveler2525
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at 15 other hotels over the course of 38 trips all on the strip. I've found my new favorite and will continue to stay here as long as Joel is working as my suite assistant. This guy is awesome, makes you feel like you are the only one he's taking care of even though he's helping a whole floor. Very engaging, remembers your name, and goes out of his way to make sure your enjoying your stay. Next time we go to Vegas my wife and I will verify Joel is working and then book our trip. We had a loft and the room was large, and the shower incredible. Hotel 32 is a great deal if you like feeling like a high roller, even when you know your not.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: NickKaren
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed for 4 nights in Vegas and as was our first time we had arranged to move around different hotels to experience them. Our first night was at Monte Carlo where we received a free upgrade to Hotel32 on arrival. Incredible room, everything to a high standard. Having private concierge service and private lounge/breakfast area was outstanding. We were sorry to leave the Monte Carlo after the first night. While we stayed in other more expensive hotels in our trip to Vegas this was definitely the best value for money experience that we had. We will definitely be staying here next time we go back to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and personal service - simply perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Tober138
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a four-night stay at Hotel32 at Monte Carlo and, down to the smallest detail, everything was simply perfect. I will not go into detail repeating what others have said in recent reviews but, like others, we were greeted at the airport by our limo driver and taken to the front entrance of the Monte Carlo where a bellman was waiting to take our bags and escort us up to the Hotel32 lobby. We were then greeted by a suite assistant who gave us a brief tour of the lounge and offered us a drink before taking us to our Loft suite and giving us a tour and checking us in on the spot. The Lofts are quite spacious, about 1200 square feet with a separate living / dining area and bedroom, which is great if, like us, you tend to be night-owls in Vegas and spend some downtime in the room during the day. Having the in-room coffee / expresso / cappucino machine was wonderful for when we rolled out of bed in the morning. And the 8-head, chromotherapy shower was a nice, luxurious touch (never mind that it was large enough to easily accommodate four people - should you ever find a need to simultaneously shower with three other individuals while in Vegas) as was the large, jetted soaker tub. The in-mirror TV was a cute detail. The king-sized bed was extremely comfortable as well and, along with the fact that we never once heard any noise from the hallway or another room, resulted in some of the best nights' sleep I've ever had in a room in Vegas before. Everything in the room worked perfectly and the twice-per-day maid service never missed a thing. The only (very minor) complaint about the room was that, in a room of this size, there was very little closet space (one small closet in the bedroom to the left of the TV) - but that is a very minor detail. The lounge was a nice bonus. We did not generally partake of the small hors d' oeuvres for the most part (although the few we did try were quite tasty), but it was great being able to grab a bottle of water or soda on our way out or when returning to our room. However, it was the personalized service, from pre-check in through check-out, that truly sets this property apart from others on the strip, and will likely bring us back on our next trip. When I was called the week prior for our flight information, they asked if we had any special requests for stocking the mini-bar. We asked for a few small items (including a bottle of Bacardi 8) and found them waiting for us in the room when we arrived. The suite assistants were continually gracious and accommodating throughout our stay. It truly was a matter of, "if you ask for it, we will take care of it." In fact, we even recieved a few items that we did not ask for. Although we booked our room a few months prior, my girlfriend and I deceided about 2 weeks before the trip that we were going to elope while in Vegas. This was mentioned to the suite assistant checking us in only through an offhand remark when she asked if my girlfriend shared the same last name as myself; I responded that, "it will be in two days." The day before our wedding, every suite assistant that we came into contact with stopped us to wish us luck (including those we had not previously spoken with). And upon return from our wedding activities on Friday afternoon, we were plesantly surprised to find some candles, bath salts, chocolate covered strawberries and a chilled bottle of champagne waiting for us in our suite - a small gift from the staff, which we thought was a very sweet gesture on their part. Overall, our experience at Hotel32 was simply perfect, and we will likely abondon our practice of staying at a different property each time we come to Vegas and return here instead on future visits (I did say this once before after staying at TheHotel for the first time a few years ago, but this time I truly think that this decision will stick).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: KJJackson
Reviews.Content: Our stay started with limo pick up from the airport. The driver was already waiting for us at baggage claim, and was very friendly, he even agreed to make a stop on the way to the Hotel with no hesitation at all. Upon arrival at the Hotel we were immediately greeted by a bellhop who was very informative about Hotel 32 on the elevator ride up to the 32nd floor of the Monte Carlo.As soon as we stepped off the elevator, our Suite Assistant was waiting for us and escorted us to our Loft Suite. He gave us a tour of our suite while the bellhop went for ice. Yes, you do actually need a tour of a 1200 sq. ft. suite especially when the shower is operated by something I can only compare to an i pod and the espresso/coffee machine has about a dozen different functions! They promise mint on your pillow ease and celebrity treatment and they deliver on all aspects! This is by no means our first trip to Vegas staying in a luxurious suite, in fact this is actually the smallest suite we have stayed in, but the attentive service puts this above almost all others. The only experience to rival this was our stay in a Salon Suite at The Wynn. Our room was beautiful, exceptionally clean, and the twice daily housekeeping was without fail. No, this is not the SkyLofts, in my opinion this is better. Not only do you get the excellent service, beautiful rooms, and limo service, but if you are not a rich person you can actually afford to to stay here, gamble here, and have plenty left over for all the shopping and fine dining you can stand elsewhere! With tram access to Aria and Bellagio if you want something a little more upscale than the Monte Carlo Casino, it is just a few short moments away! We had a wonderful stay, and while we like to try different suites at the Hotels along the strip, we will definitely be back to Hotel 32, maybe in one of the Penthouse suites with a pool table next time!

Reviews.Title: “Cordial Staff with Minor Issues”
Reviews.Author: HotelGirl811
Reviews.Content: I found Hotel 32 on the Monte Carlo Website and decided to give it a whirl. One of the perks is that you receive complimentary limo transportation to and from the airport. Had our limo driver not been 30 min late to pick us up I may have been more excited by this feature. We also asked if we could drive thru In & Out burger on the way to the hotel and were told he could not make any stops...a little more flexibilty would have been nice. When we got to the hotel we were escorted upstairs and met by one of the personal assistants (Roy). He was very cordial and walked us through the lounge and our checkin. I had pre-ordered champagne, balloons, and a birthday cake for my friends birthday and everything was in the room and looked great! I had also pre-ordered some items for our minibar however they were not in the room as requested. I did speak with Ashley at the desk and she had everything delivered while we were in the casino. As we were headed down to the pool the next day Hilda (another assistant) called down and held four chairs for us. When we arrived at the pool we were taken to our chairs, each given two towels, and two tubes (for the lazy river). Andrea was our server and introduced us to Sweet Tea flavored vodka mixed with frozen lemonade....AMAZING! The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom clean (Kohler fixtures and Kiehl's bath products). The only real snag during the whole trip was that both my debit card and credit card were auth for the room. I would highly recommend that you confirm that you are not "pre-registered" so that you have time to verify which form of payment you would like to use. My debit card funds were tied up all weekend. I didn't hear back from anyone like I was supposed to have on Sat however when I finally connected with the supervisor (Ruth) she handled it professionaly and rectified the situation to my satisfaction. What could have been a nightmare ended up ok. Overall if you don't mind "reactiveness" verses "proactiveness" you will probably enjoy your stay. If they could nail down their service mishaps Hotel 32 would definitely be worth the difference in price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Upgade From Standard Monte Carlo Rooms, Limo Service Is A Nice Plus”
Reviews.Author: Jtorsney
Reviews.Content: Hotel32 starts by being picked up at the airport in a limo and driven to the hotel. Guests are then taken to the 32nd floor where suite assistance handle check-in, avoiding lines downstairs. I booked a studio, which was about the same size as a Monte Carlo standard room with upgraded furnishings. Studios come with a shower only which is a bit of a pity. Studios also do not include tea/coffee makers, which is a minor miss. Suite Assistants also handle pre-arrival requests such as having your refrigerator stocked, which is a nice touch. The 32nd floor lounge has complimentary breakfast and appetizers for dinner, with soft beverages available throughout the day. Champagne by the glass is available at additional cost. Kudos to Joel, Enar, Ashley, Oscar, and Hilda, who made my stay more enjoyable. Generally speaking, I would rate Hotel32 below Four Seasons, THE hotel at Mandalay Bay, Wynn/Encore, Bellagio and Aria but above many other properties in the city. Reader's enjoyment may depend on how much they like Monte Carlo generally. The complimentary limo ride back to the airport is a nice departure bonus.

Reviews.Title: “nothing really special would rather have stayed at Bellagio or Aria”
Reviews.Author: harvickfan83815
Reviews.Content: First off, I did not pay for my room, I was staying with someone who had the room comped but if I had to pay for the room I would have been disappointed. I stayed in a studio room which seemed to be very small and nothing more than a regular hotel room. The bed was comfortable and the tv was nice but those things are pretty standard now days. There was no tub only a narrow shower and the lighting in the bathroom was way too dim and there was no where to put anything it seemed. When we came back into the room the first night we found it to whistle and the only way to make it stop was to crack open the window but then you could hear the traffic but it was not as annoying as the whistling sound. Also the curtains did not fully close, thankfully a hair clip did the trick. The cool things were the limo transfer to and from the airport, robes and slippers, free voss waters, the small and weird fruit welcome amenity, and free sodas in the little lounge. Most of the staff on the 32nd floor seemed to be nice except for a grouchy man in the lounge one morning and I didn't get his name but if one is going to be serving guests of VIP status they should at least pretend to like their job and make the guests feel welcome. There was an issue with the Cafe at the Monte Carlo, service was below standards and as was the food, we were seated at a filthy dusty table and when asking the server to wipe off the table she reluctantly wiped off only the part in front of the person with me and didn't even do my side. The food was not bad but it wasn't really good either. The pub had great service and much better food, except for one bartender who was kind of a jerk one nght. If you want good guacamole go to Diablo's it was the best however the rest of their food seemed mediocre and overpriced. The resort fee was waived thankfully because although it includes use of the spa and fitness facilities, the spa was to say the least, pitiful. The jacuzzi was not warm and there are no jets and it smelled really bad of chlorine. The pool area at the Monte Carlo is overrun with small children and really bad loud music and some area's kind of smell like sewer. As far as the casino goes, I found it to just suck up my money and none of the machines would even play with me. I enjoyed playing at the Aria on 20.00 for over 5.5 hours where the cocktail waitresses were friendly and they were always coming by before I even had time to finish my drink from the last time they came by, it was by far the best casino experience. Now I would stay here again for free because who doesn't like free, but if I had a choice to stay at Bellagio or aria I would stay there instead. I have stayed at the Bellgio many times and their standard room is nicer than the studio at Hotel 32.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Debbiloft69
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying in a loft at Hotel 32.One of the best features was Lisa in the VIP Services.She could not have been more helpful in taking the time arranging places for us to go and directing some of my friends who were first timers in Vegas places to see.we definitely were treated like VIP the whole stay upstairs and downstairs.the only thing that was disappointing with the second trip was no snacks like nuts and chex mix throughout the day in the shot glasses upstairs.But thanks to Lisa we had a wonderful stay and cant wait to go back in Feb.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of extras”
Reviews.Author: mindme
Reviews.Content: With the down economy, rooms in Vegas are going for some pretty attractive rates. But they get you with food and beverages. Hotel32 presents a compelling package: luxury, VIP treatment, and free food/beverages but at a price point you're accustomed to paying for a standard room in almost any major North American city outside of Vegas. The studio rooms at Hotel32 provide the best value. Pickup/drop off at the airport in a real Bellagio limo (not a town car). You're whisked to the VIP check in. There's free soft drinks and food in the club room throughout the day. And you're taken care of nicely by a "butler" dedicated to your floor. Nod to Hotel32's Joel (I think he works monday - friday) who really bends over backwards for a floor guest. The limo pickup/drop off is a very nice feature. A limo driver greets you at baggage pickup in the airport with your name on a card. He hauls your bags off of the belt for you and escorts you away. Everyone in baggage claim is wondering who the big shot it. Your drop off to the airport is booked to your schedule. No having to frog march yourself onto a crowded shuttle van that comes once an hour. The breakfast in the club room was a great way to start your day. The free bottled Voss water was great to take with you while you're out and about. Dinner time there's a light meal served in the club room and free coffee and wine down in the VIP lounge. The location is pretty good too. You're on a free tram line that runs north and gets you in air conditioned comfort to City Center, Bellagio, and Caesar's Palace. You're a short walk to New York New and then Excalibur and its tram line to Mandalay bay.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and great value”
Reviews.Author: Sir_Topham_hatt
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with our 16 year old son and wanted to treat him to something nice. The check-in person offered me an upgrade to a Hotel 32 "LOFT" for $120/night more than the cost of the room we reserved. It was a 1200 square foot suite so I decided to splurge and upgrade. What a great decision! The room is the size of 3 of their standard hotel rooms. The loft had double doors in the entryway and when you walked in, there was a beautiful living area that was the size of 2 hotel rooms. It had a large wrap-around sofa, lots of small seating and a high dining table with plenty of seating. The bedroom had a California king and was super comfy. The bathroom was wonderful - double frosted glass doors on sliders to enter. 2 sinks, one on each side. Toilet area was enclosed in frameless frosted glass, affording plenty of privacy. There was a huge deep soaking tub with an overflow trough so you could fill it to the top. The shower was 4' x 6' with a marble seating bench. There were 8 shower heads in the frameless glass shower - YES - 8! 4 in the ceiling and 4 on the wall. You could program the shower to simulate a thunder storm, a sunrise, calm waters, etc, all with lighting. It was easy to operate, too. The mirror above one of the sinks had a TV behind the mirror so you could watch TV while using the bathroom - nice touch. And, speaking of TV's, there were 3 other large (maybe 52"?) flat screens in the suite - 1 in the bedroom, 1 in the living room and 1 in the dining area. If all this wasn't enough, the coolest part was the wireless "Crestron" - there were 2 of them. From either one, you could remotely open the sheers, the drapes, turn on/off all the lights, TV, volume, air conditioning, etc. That was so much fun to use. I had only 1 complaint. We stayed there 6 nights (so we weren't just a one night guest) and when I got home, I checked out Hotel32 on their website and learned we were supposed to get free airport limo pick up and drop off. When I first checked-in, I was clear that I was waiting for my husband and son to arrive from the airport in a few hours. The host even suggest I wait in the Hotel32 lounge for them to arrive. No mention that they could send a complimentary limo to pick them up and I didn't know to ask because I didn't know we were staying there until check-in. When we checked out, we checked out with the suite assistant on the 32nd floor. Again, it was obvious we were heading to the airport and no offer of a free ride in a limo to the airport. If you include something in a room rate, you should offer it and ask the guests if they need the service, especially to a guest that stayed with you 6 nights - It was supposed to be included in the cost of our stay. I mentioned this to MC on their Facebook page and in an email survey, and so far, no response which is surprising because the service and friendliness of their staff while we were there was wonderful. Aside from the limo disappointment, I would give Hotel32 an A+ and would stay there again (requesting a limo, of course). If you are looking for a real treat for your next trip to Vegas, Hotel32 is a great choice. Stay in a loft. The pictures of the studios look more like a regular hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “hotel 32 nice rooms horrible service and staff”
Reviews.Author: CCB13
Reviews.Content: I have never been to a hotel where I felt so unwelcome by the staff. Every time I walked by the front desk from the elevators to my room there was no hello or smiles on anybody's faces. I went to go tell someone that our shower was leaking and the toilet didn't flush and the girl out front couldn't be bothered to finish her personal phone call to come help me. Every time I asked a question or needed something they made feel like I was bothering them. Not the "Stay with us and get instant entry to a rarified world few experience. Where every P is a VIP. Where every whim and glance is attended to with mint-on-your-pillow ease. Where you'll be pampered and indulged without end" quoted on their website. The only thing they did follow through on is the outstanding rooms. If you are a young professional looking for a nice place to stay with great service this is not the hotel for you. Unless you are over middle aged this staff will not give you the time of day regardless of how much money you spend their rooms or spend in their casino. My wife and I go to Vegas multiple times a year and stay all over the strip and have never been treated like this from a low end casino let alone one that is trying to build its reputation on VIP service for every Person.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: alp3073
Reviews.Content: We spent my husband's 40th birthday in vegas, and rented a 1 bedroom pent for 4 days. We had approx 22 people also staying the hotel. Pickup at the airport went smoothly, and check in was very fast & easy. We had a party in our room one day, and the staff was wonderful helping to order food/drinks as well as organizing reservations/etc for our group. The room was very nice, the bathroom was beautiful. The steam didn't work in the shower, and they were not able to fix it during our stay, so they offered us 2 spa services. I had faily low expecations of the spa, but it was very comfortable. The Monte Carlo as a whole is not my favorite hotel, but it's affordable to eveyone if you have a group going. Hotel 32 was a much improved experience over just staying at Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise!”
Reviews.Author: ski_maxski
Reviews.Content: I didn't know what to expect from Hotel32 and was pleasantly surprise by this hotel. It delivered on the promises made in the marketing email I received!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but way overpriced”
Reviews.Author: MIKE-TRIP
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in some nice penthouses on the strip including my favorite the skylofts at MGM. I stayed in a 2 bedroom penthouse at hotel 32 and even though it was nice it was average. The cost was $1200 per night. The skylofts run from $600 --$1250 per night for a 2 floor 2 bedroom penthouse. The only thing that was better in this room over the other penthouses were the bathrooms. They could of used a better TV in the bathrooms but that aside they were nice. Hotel 32 prides themselves on saying they are a sister to the Skylofts. Well in this comparrison the Skyloft is a bikini model and Hotel 32 is the pretty girl next door that just has that 1 weird thing about her that you just can't really put your finger on LOL. I would visit again if the room was more like $400-$500 per. No extras like free beverages or snacks in your room. They do offer some free treats all day down the hall. I didn't find anything in there I was crazy about but they do go the extra mile in there for you. Very nice people. They cater to you but don't crowd you like the skylofts. One thing I disliked and find trashy is the bathroom is all glass even the entrance door to the bathroom. I don't and I repeat don't want to see someone going to the bathroom. The bathroom should have a wooden door. It's like this in a regular suite also I was told. No women is that pretty to be seen using a bathroom.......now add 15 years of marriage to that and it gets sadder LOL. Didn't use the pool. They have a floating river and wave pool but its very small. Mandalay bay has the same type of pool area but the wave and river pools are much much larger then Monte carlo (hotel 32). The casino was fun but very low maximum bets. $50 on 3 card poker and Let it ride. The tables had low minimun bets though $5 and $10. The slots were very loose. One other thing. The web site makes the penthouses seem better then they really are. They are nice but at a reasonable rate. Have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Low key hotel with great location on the Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: trish3b28
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Vegas many time but never at the Monte Carlo. It was a great value during the over priced Labor Day weekend. It was a low key hotel. You can't beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: HardSix9to1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel 32 in the 1200 sqft Loft suite and it was fantastic. My stay was comped but these rooms normally go for $600 a night. All 4 nights of my stay were quiet and comfortable. If you book a room at Hotel 32, they will send a limo to pick you up from the airport and take you to the main Monte Carlo entrance. There a suite assistant will greet you and escort you to the 32nd floor to check in. There is almost never any line up at the hotel 32 front desk. The assistants will take you for a tour of your room and teach you how to use the LCD control box to turn on the TV's, lights and drapes. Even the shower is electronic! I was impressed. The bed was extra comfy. The Monte Carlo itself is a very quiet casino compared to the others on the strip. In the evenings, other hotels would be full of people gambling, walking around, drinking, etc. The Monte Carlo just didn't compare, especially in the category of having beautiful people around. Sigh. The gambling for this trip was fantastic for me and I was able to leave Las Vegas as a winner. Drink service at the tables were average and the dealers on the most part were friendly and wanted you to win. I ate at the 24 hour Cafe and the Pub once and the food was above average. Didn't try the buffet but I've had it before in prior trips and it was ok. I saw Terry Fator and Love this trip and I liked Terry Fator the best. Love was kind of boring for me but I'm not old enough to appreciate the Beatles. Overall my stay at Hotel 32 was great. My room, food and beverage was all comped. I highly recommend Hotel 32 as a great floor to stay on but the casino itself could be a little more alive.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel32 at Monte Carlo
HotelInfo.Address: 3770 Las Vegas Blvd. South, Top Floor of Monte Carlo Casino, Las Vegas, NV
